Description: Top-level grouping for Common Core ELA/Literacy competencies (CCR Anchor Standards)
Parent for CCSS ELA CCR Reading Anchor Standards (R1–R10).
Parent for CCSS ELA CCR Writing Anchor Standards (W1–W10).
Parent for CCSS ELA CCR Speaking & Listening Anchor Standards (SL1–SL6).
Parent for CCSS ELA CCR Language Anchor Standards (L1–L6).
R.1: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences; cite evidence.
R.2: Determine central ideas or themes and analyze their development; summarize key supporting details and ideas.
R.3: Analyze how and why individuals events and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
R.4: Interpret words and phrases; analyze how word choice shapes meaning or tone.
R.5: Analyze the structure of texts including how parts relate to each other and to the whole.
R.6: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes content and style.
R.7: Integrate and evaluate content in diverse media and formats.
R.8: Delineate and evaluate arguments and specific claims reasoning and evidence.
R.9: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes/topics to build knowledge or compare approaches.
R.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
W.1: Write arguments to support claims with reasons and evidence.
W.2: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey ideas clearly and accurately.
W.3: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences using effective technique and structure.
W.4: Produce clear and coherent writing appropriate to task purpose and audience.
W.5: Develop and strengthen writing through planning revising editing rewriting or trying a new approach.
W.6: Use technology to produce and publish writing and collaborate with others.
W.7: Conduct short and sustained research projects to answer questions or solve problems.
W.8: Gather relevant information from multiple sources assess credibility and integrate while avoiding plagiarism.
W.9: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis reflection and research.
W.10: Write routinely over extended and shorter time frames for a range of tasks and purposes.
SL.1: Prepare for and participate effectively in collaborative discussions.
SL.2: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats.
SL.3: Evaluate a speaker's point of view reasoning and use of evidence and rhetoric.
SL.4: Present information findings and supporting evidence clearly and logically.
SL.5: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays to enhance understanding.
SL.6: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks demonstrating command of formal English when appropriate.
L.1: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage.
L.2: Demonstrate command of the conventions of capitalization punctuation and spelling.
L.3: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts and to improve writing/speaking.
L.4: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases.
L.5: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
L.6: Acquire and use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases.
